title: (x) Endless website logo - modified Cosmos {Gary Schmidt}
content:
Have you ever seen this font before? It is the header “endless”. Can someone tell me what font it is and where I can find it? [http://www.endless.com/homepage/ref=topnav\_gw\_gw](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706223802/http:/www.endless.com/homepage/ref=topnav_gw_gw)  
I have never been attracted to a font before! Thanks in advance

 [‹ (x) Looking for alternatives to Aviano](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706223802/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35470 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Cold War Kids logo - Bodoni Poster Italic {Eric Hague} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706223802/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35441 "Go to next forum topic")
author: autumnteress

comments.content: When designing trademarks it is not necessary to select a font but create an image that can’t be copied or confused with a particular type font. Many trademarks start out as type as in the case of IBM when Paul Rand modified City Bold.
Yes, that’s true, but the starting point for this is still Cosmos.
